intro: Erysimum guneri, commonly known as the Hungarian wallflower, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
